Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Phylum \Phy"lum\, n.; pl. {Phyla}. [NL. See {Phylon}.] 1. (Zo["o]l.) One of the larger divisions of the animal kingdom; a branch; a grand division. [1913 Webster]
2. (Biol.) A series of animals or plants genetically connected. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
phylum n 1: (linguistics) a large group of languages that are historically related 2: (biology) the major taxonomic group of animals and plants; contains classes [also: {phyla} (pl)]
